name: "Fables": Animal Farm Online Quiz | Fables | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which two characters, accompanied by Colin the Pig, are taking off for the Farm?
questions.explanation:
Rose Red and Snow White.

	Twice a year, Snow White goes up to the Farm to check on things, but she soon runs into some very angry animals, although she doesn't suspect much at first. Rose and Snow took off in the sixth issue of "Fables", which originally debuted in 2002.

questions.text: What does Snow White discover en route to the Farm?
questions.explanation:
Spent bullet casings.

	Very strong spells are used to keep the Farm out of notice of regular humans, and since nobody reported a gunshot, Snow finds the evidence suspicious. Rose Red, however, could care less. Snow thought something was amiss in the sixth issue of "Fables", which went on sale in 2002.

questions.text: Who was the head administrator at the Farm before the rebellion?
questions.explanation:
Weyland Smith.

	Weyland is first seen in the eighth issue of "Fables", which came out in 2003. He was imprisoned by the rioting animals and forced to make weapons for them. Snow comes upon Weyland when she is escaping from the Farm with the help of Reynard the fox.

questions.text: Who insisted that Colin's head be placed on a pole?
questions.explanation:
Goldilocks.

	Goldilocks is one of the leaders of the rebellion and is in a relationship with Boo Bear, the grown-up Baby Bear of the Three Bears. She lectured about the oppression that the human-looking Fables supposedly placed on the animal-appearing Fables. Goldilocks first appeared in the seventh issue of "Fables", which went on sale in 2003.

questions.text: Which animal remains loyal to Snow White, helping her escape?
questions.explanation:
Reynard the Fox.

	Reynard first appeared in the seventh issue of "Fables", which went on sale in 2003. Escaping attempts on his life made by Shere Khan, Baghera, Goldilocks, and more, he helped Snow White escape and later helped in the Battle of Fabletown.

questions.text: Who did NOT go on the rescue mission?
questions.explanation:
Pinocchio.

	Prince Charming, Bluebeard, Boy Blue, and Bufkin the Flying Monkey all load into a red sedan and start driving to the Farm to rescue Snow White and Rose Red. Due to past actions against the Three Little Pigs, Bigby Wolf is not allowed at the Farm. These events happened in the ninth issue of "Fables", which debuted in 2003.

Shere Khan.

	Shere Khan, from Rudyard Kipling's stories, hunts Reynard and Snow White until Snow shoots him repeatedly with a gun that Reynard had given to her.  These events happened in the ninth issue, which went on sale in 2003.

options: It is blown down by Bigby Wolf
It is boarded up by Weyland Smith
It is turned into Reynard's home
questions.explanation:
A dragon burns it down.

	Snow White enlists three giants and a dragon as a show of force against the rebellion, ordering the malcontents to disperse and surrender. Not all was well, however, as Goldilocks then shot Snow White in the head. These events happen in the tenth issue of "Fables", debuting in 2003.

questions.text: What happened to the two remaining pigs?
questions.explanation:
They were executed.

	Jack Ketch cut off Dun and Posey's heads as punishment for their leadership roles in the rebellion. They are resistant to the end, and their bodies are hauled off by a goblin. These events happened in the tenth issue of "Fables", which went on sale in 2003.

questions.text: Rose Red is the new administrator at the Farm.
questions.explanation:
True.

	In the tenth issue, released in 2003, Rose Red is named as the new administrator at the now-peaceful Farm, leaving Weyland Smith free to make more guns for the non-human Fables.
